Package eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.dao

Class DAOCloud

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.st.cryptoac.dao.DAOCloud
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DAOCloudAWS, DAOCloudLOCAL
    public abstract class DAOCloud
extends java.lang.Object
    this abstract class described the operations to be implemented needed by the logic ("User" class) in order to access data stored in the "cloud". So, if you are planning to implement a new storage solution for a new cloud provider (OpenStack, Azure, ...), read what follows thoroughly Remember that the DAO has to be agnostic with respect to the consistency of the data and their completeness. Thus, such checks are performed by the invoking class (the "User" class) Note: since it is not possible to know all possible exceptions that can be thrown by this class implementation, here's the deal: if an exception arise, handle it locally and instead throw a new DAOException embedding in it the original exception and setting the proper error code (see OperationOutcomeCode for the list of possible codes. If none suits your situation, set the generic error code or create a new one). If you want, check and use the "logAtEndOfFunction" function here implemented to do it automatically

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract void addFileToCloud​(File newFile, FileTuple newFileTuple, PermissionTuple newPermissionTuple)
      This function adds a new file to the cloud along with its metadata, the entry in the database table and related the permission tuple.
      abstract void addPermissionTupleToCloud​(PermissionTuple newPermissionTupleGivingPermissionsToRole)
      This function adds a PermissionTuple to the cloud Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void addRoleToCloud​(Role newRole, RoleTuple newRoleTuple)
      This function adds a new role to the cloud along with the admin's tuples.
      abstract void addRoleTupleToCloud​(RoleTuple newRoleTupleBindingUserAndRole)
      This function adds a RoleTuple to the cloud Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void addUserToCloud​(User newUserToInsert)
      This function adds a new user to the cloud.
      abstract void deleteFileFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      delete the given file from the currently used storage solution.
      abstract void deletePermissionTupleByRoleNameAndFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName, java.lang.String fileName)
      delete the permission tuple that matches the given parameters Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void deletePermissionTupleByRoleNameAndVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName, int roleKeysVersionNumber)
      delete the permission tuples that match the given parameters Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void deletePermissionTuplesByFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      delete all the permission tuples that match the given file name Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void deleteRoleFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      delete the given role from the currently used storage solution Actually, like the user, this doesn't delete the role object, because its public key may be used to verify signatures.
      abstract void deleteRoleTuplesByRoleNameAndVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName, int roleKeysVersionNumber)
      delete the role tuples that match the given parameters.
      abstract void deleteRoleTuplesByRoleNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      delete the role tuples that match the given parameter Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void deleteUserFromCloud​(java.lang.String username)
      delete the given user from the currently used storage solution.
      abstract java.lang.Object[] downloadFileFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String pathWhereToSaveFile)
      this method queries the DAO to retrieve the LATEST version of the requested file Who can invoke this function? USERS ONLY
      static DAOCloud getDAO​(java.lang.String selectedDAO)
      This method is not overridable.
      abstract FileTuple getFileTuplesByFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching FileTuple (so the file and its metadata) Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.lang.Integer getFileVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      get the file version number (from the file object, not from fileTuple) Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getListOfFilesFromCloud()
      simply return a list containing the IDs of files actually present in the cloud Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<PermissionTuple> getPermissionTuplesByFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching PermissionTuples Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<PermissionTuple> getPermissionTuplesByRoleNameAndFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName, java.lang.String fileName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching PermissionTuple Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<PermissionTuple> getPermissionTuplesByRoleNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching PermissionTuples Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.security.PublicKey getPublicKeyOfRoleFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      this method queries the DAO to retrieve the key of a role Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.security.PublicKey getPublicKeyOfUserFromCloud​(java.lang.String username)
      this method queries the DAO to retrieve the key of a user Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract RoleTuple getRoleTupleByUsernameAndRoleNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String roleName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching RoleTuple Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<RoleTuple> getRoleTuplesByRoleNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching RoleTuples Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.util.HashSet<RoleTuple> getRoleTuplesByUsernameFromCloud​(java.lang.String username)
      Query the specific DAO to get the matching RoleTuples Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      abstract java.lang.Integer getRoleVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
      get the role version number Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
      void initializeAdminInCloud​(java.security.KeyPair adminKeys)
      This function initialize the admin user in the cloud.
      abstract void lockDAOStatus()
      This method is invoked by the "User" class before starting a sequence of operations on the DAO to avoid inconsistencies when errors arise.
      protected void logAtEndOfFunction​(OperationOutcomeCode code, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.Exception cause)
      just to wrap the common code at the end of each function.
      abstract void rollback()
      This method is invoked after a sequence of operations on the DAO stopped because of an error, and now the storage/database is in an inconsistent state.
      abstract void unlockDAOStatus()
      This method is invoked after a sequence of operations on the DAO went well in order to remove the lock from the storage NOTE: you should actually save files/commit changes only when every lock has been removed (thus the lock counter becomes 0)
      abstract void updateFileInCloud​(File updatedFile, FileTuple updatedFileTuple)
      update file in the cloud (usually corresponds to a "write" operation).
      abstract void updateFileVersionNumberInCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
      increment the file version number by 1 (of the file object, not of fileTuple) Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void updateRoleKeyInCloud​(java.lang.String roleName, java.security.PublicKey rolePublicKey)
      update both the role's key and its version number (version number =+ 1) Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
      abstract void updateUserKeyInCloud​(java.lang.String username, java.security.PublicKey userPublicKey)
      update the user's public key in the cloud.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • className

        protected static java.lang.String className
        the name of this class (modify in your DAO)

      • locksOnDAO

        protected int locksOnDAO
        number of locks on the DAO. This is for implementing a "rollback" mechanism in case something goes wrong in the middle of a transaction. See the three functions "lockDAOStatus", "unlockDAOStatus" and "rollback" at the end for more details

    • Method Detail

      • initializeAdminInCloud

        public void initializeAdminInCloud​(java.security.KeyPair adminKeys)
                            throws DAOException
        This function initialize the admin user in the cloud. It means that before starting to invoke the DAO, this function must be invoked first to add the admin both as a user and as a role in your storage solution In practice, this function: - creates a new User named "admin" and add it to the cloud ("addUserToCloud" function) - creates a new Role named "admin" with the same keys as the user and add it to the cloud ("addRoleToCloud" function) - creates a new RoleTuple that binds the admin User and the admin Role ("addRoleTupleToCloud" function) Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        adminKeys - the PKI keys of the admin
        Throws:
        DAOException - is something goes wrong. There is an error code inside this exception

      • addUserToCloud

        public abstract void addUserToCloud​(User newUserToInsert)
                             throws DAOException
        This function adds a new user to the cloud. Remember that users' IDs (username) are unique. Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        newUserToInsert - the user object to insert
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • addRoleToCloud

        public abstract void addRoleToCloud​(Role newRole,
                                    RoleTuple newRoleTuple)
                             throws DAOException
        This function adds a new role to the cloud along with the admin's tuples. Remember that roles' IDs (role names) are unique Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        newRole - the role to insert
        newRoleTuple - the tuple of role to insert
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • addFileToCloud

        public abstract void addFileToCloud​(File newFile,
                                    FileTuple newFileTuple,
                                    PermissionTuple newPermissionTuple)
                             throws DAOException
        This function adds a new file to the cloud along with its metadata, the entry in the database table and related the permission tuple. Remember that files' IDs (file names) are unique Who can invoke this function? USERS ONLY
        Parameters:
        newFile - the new file
        newFileTuple - the new file tuple
        newPermissionTuple - the new permission tuple (giving the admin access to the file)
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

        Parameters:
        username - name of the user that has to match in the tuple
        Returns:
        an hash set filled with the tuples, if any. Otherwise, an empty set
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • getPermissionTuplesByRoleNameAndFileNameFromCloud

        public abstract java.util.HashSet<PermissionTuple> getPermissionTuplesByRoleNameAndFileNameFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName,
                                                                                                     java.lang.String fileName)
                                                                                              throws DAOException
        Query the specific DAO to get the matching PermissionTuple Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
        Parameters:
        roleName - name of the role that has to match in the tuple
        fileName - name of the file that has to match in the tuple
        Returns:
        an hash set filled with the tuples, if any. Otherwise, an empty set. Note that there can be multiple permission tuples for the same combination file-role (read referenced paper for details)
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • getFileVersionNumberFromCloud

        public abstract java.lang.Integer getFileVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                         throws DAOException
        get the file version number (from the file object, not from fileTuple) Who can invoke this function? BOTH ADMIN AND USER
        Parameters:
        fileName - the ID of the file
        Returns:
        the version number, null if the file doesn't exist
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • deleteUserFromCloud

        public abstract void deleteUserFromCloud​(java.lang.String username)
                                  throws DAOException
        delete the given user from the currently used storage solution. Actually, you don't delete it, because we may need his key later on to verify some signatures. So just sets a flag Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        username - the ID of the user
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • deleteRoleFromCloud

        public abstract void deleteRoleFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName)
                                  throws DAOException
        delete the given role from the currently used storage solution Actually, like the user, this doesn't delete the role object, because its public key may be used to verify signatures. So jut flag it Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        roleName - the ID of the role
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • deleteFileFromCloud

        public abstract void deleteFileFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName)
                                  throws DAOException
        delete the given file from the currently used storage solution. This methods should both delete the file entry from the database/file/storage and the file itself from the cloud (thus the file tuple) Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        fileName - the ID of the file
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • deleteRoleTuplesByRoleNameAndVersionNumberFromCloud

        public abstract void deleteRoleTuplesByRoleNameAndVersionNumberFromCloud​(java.lang.String roleName,
                                                                         int roleKeysVersionNumber)
                                                                  throws DAOException
        delete the role tuples that match the given parameters. Who can invoke this function? ADMIN ONLY
        Parameters:
        roleName - the role to which the tuple must belong to
        roleKeysVersionNumber - the version number of the tuple
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • updateUserKeyInCloud

        public abstract void updateUserKeyInCloud​(java.lang.String username,
                                          java.security.PublicKey userPublicKey)
                                   throws DAOException
        update the user's public key in the cloud. Note: server-side, we should check that the invoker of this function is modifying its own entry in the database, not others. This function is invoked when the new user registers into the system Who can invoke this function? USER ONLY
        Parameters:
        username - the ID of the user
        userPublicKey - the new key
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • updateFileInCloud

        public abstract void updateFileInCloud​(File updatedFile,
                                       FileTuple updatedFileTuple)
                                throws DAOException
        update file in the cloud (usually corresponds to a "write" operation). The behaviour is overwriting (or versioning, if supported) the previous file. If the file didn't exist before, return error Who can invoke this function? USERS ONLY
        Parameters:
        updatedFile - the updated file
        updatedFileTuple - the updated file tuple
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • downloadFileFromCloud

        public abstract java.lang.Object[] downloadFileFromCloud​(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                         java.lang.String pathWhereToSaveFile)
                                                  throws DAOException
        this method queries the DAO to retrieve the LATEST version of the requested file Who can invoke this function? USERS ONLY
        Parameters:
        fileName - the id of the file
        pathWhereToSaveFile - path where to save the downloaded file
        Returns:
        two objects: File and FileTuple, if any. Null otherwise
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • lockDAOStatus

        public abstract void lockDAOStatus()
                            throws DAOException
        This method is invoked by the "User" class before starting a sequence of operations on the DAO to avoid inconsistencies when errors arise. For instance, this method could take a snapshot of the storage solution in order to be able to rollback in case something goes wrong, or (if using a MySQL database) set the "autocommit" flag to OFF Note: if the method was already invoked once (and the lock was not already released by "unlockDAOStatus" or "rollback", further invocations should just increment a counter and return "true" without doing anything.
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • unlockDAOStatus

        public abstract void unlockDAOStatus()
                              throws DAOException
        This method is invoked after a sequence of operations on the DAO went well in order to remove the lock from the storage NOTE: you should actually save files/commit changes only when every lock has been removed (thus the lock counter becomes 0)
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • rollback

        public abstract void rollback()
                       throws DAOException
        This method is invoked after a sequence of operations on the DAO stopped because of an error, and now the storage/database is in an inconsistent state. NOTE: for performance reasons, you should actually rollback only when every lock has been removed (thus the lock counter becomes 0)
        Throws:
        DAOException - if something went wrong in the process, just throw an DAOException. For better user experience, add the proper OperationOutcomeCode code to the DAOException message (both number and message)

      • logAtEndOfFunction

        protected void logAtEndOfFunction​(OperationOutcomeCode code,
                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                  java.lang.Exception cause)
                           throws DAOException
        just to wrap the common code at the end of each function. This function should be invoked at the end of each one of the high-level functions (the abstract ones)
        Parameters:
        code - code to log
        methodName - name of the method invoking this function
        cause - the original exception
        Throws:
        DAOException - eventual DAOException to print

      • getDAO

        public static DAOCloud getDAO​(java.lang.String selectedDAO)
                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                              java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                              java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                              java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                              java.lang.InstantiationException
        This method is not overridable. Its function is to loop over the packages in the dao package in order to find the DAO selected by the user, if any
        Parameters:
        selectedDAO - the DAO selected by the user. For instance, "AWS" or "LOCAL"
        Returns:
        the DAO instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the DAO is not supported (or bad configured, e.g. with the wrong name)
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the DAO is not supported (or bad configured, e.g. with the wrong name)
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the DAO is not supported (or bad configured, e.g. with the wrong name)
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the DAO is not supported (or bad configured, e.g. with the wrong name)
        java.lang.InstantiationException - if the DAO is not supported (or bad configured, e.g. with the wrong name)
